pr_title: Enforce jar packaging by default in BuildMojo

timeline.message: Enforce jar packaging by default in BuildMojo
Enforce jar packaging by default in BuildMojo

timeline.bodyText: Do we support building the project as a WAR?
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: It seems to me that we might not need a flag but just fail the build if the project isn't packaged as a jar?
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: I also don't think we need the flag.
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText:
+1
Just fail hard and make sure the error is clear and visible.
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText:
BTW I suppose you added the flag out of fear of breaking existing applications?
Fear not, it already doesn't work if try to build it as a war. The only problem currently is that the error is very obscure.
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: Right, I thought I would add a flag to re-enable the previous behavior (which costs nothing) that could be removed in the next version if nobody complained. I didn't specifically think about war packaging/extensions. People do use custom packaging and extensions out there. But, sure, I'll obey :)
replies.author: aloubyansky
